entry.title: The Black Garden: A story of war and resilience

media:group.media:title: The Black Garden: A story of war and resilience
media:group.media:description:
CivilNet is at the 21st Annual Golden Apricot International Film Festival in Yerevan with filmmaker Alexis Pazoumian, who recently directed โThe Black Garden.โ His film captures the resilient stories of three generations living in the war-torn Talish village in Nagorno-Karabakh. From children to soldiers to war veterans, the film uncovers how this community withstands the constant threat of conflict and the toll it takes on their lives.

media:group.media:description:
2020-ีซ ีคีฅีฏีฟีฅีดีขีฅึีซ 17-ีซีถ 6 ีฐีกีต ีฆีซีถีพีธึีถีฅึ, ีธึีธีถึ ีฝีฅีบีฟีฅีดีขีฅึีซ 10-ีซึ ีทึีปีกึีกีฏีดีกีถ ีดีฅีป ีงีซีถ ิฑึึีกีญีซ ีฐีกึีกีพีธึีด, ีฐีกีฝีฅีฌ ีฅีถ ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีซ ีฝีกีฐีดีกีถีซึ ีกีพีฅีฌีซ ึีกีถ 20 ีฏีด ีฐีฅีผีกีพีธึีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีพึีก ีฃีฟีถีพีธีฒ ีดีซ ีดีธีผีกึีพีกีฎ ีฃีตีธึีฒึ ิดีฅีผ ีดีซีถีนึ 90-ีกีฏีกีถีถีฅึีจ ีฌึีพีกีฎ ีธึ ึีกีถีคีพีกีฎ ีกีตีค ีฃีตีธึีฒีจ ีฝีธีพีกีฎ ีธึ ีฎีกึีกีพ ีฆีซีถีพีธึีถีฅึีซีถ ีฟีพีฅีฌ ีง ีกีดีฅีถ ีซีถีนี ีฝีถีธึีถีค, ีปีธึึ ึ ีกีดีฅีถีกีฏีกึึีธึีจี ีฐีฅีผีกีญีธีฝีกีตีซีถ ีฏีกีบึ ิตึีฅึ ึ ึ ีกีถึ ีฆีซีถีพีธึีถีฅึีซีถ ีทึีปีกึีกีฏีธึีดีซึ ีคีธึึีฝ ีฅีถ ีขีฅึีฅีฌึ ีึีกีถึีซึ ีดีฅีฏีจ ิฑึีฉีธึึ ีีกึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีตีกีถีถ ีง, ีธึีจ 2020-ีซ ีฐีธึีฌีซีฝีซ 6-ีซีถ ีงึ ีกีถึีฅีฌ ีฎีกีผีกีตีธึีฉีตีกีถี ีึีกีฏีกีถีซ ีฆีธึีกีดีกีฝีธึีดึ

entry.title: Entrepreneur Adam Kablanian talks tech and wine in Armenia

media:group.media:title: Entrepreneur Adam Kablanian talks tech and wine in Armenia
media:group.media:description:
Did you know that three of the embedded memory components in Appleโs first iPod were designed right here in Armenia? High-tech entrepreneur, executive, and investor Adam Kablanian does โ it was his team of engineers behind that groundbreaking project.
Kablanian sits down with CivilNetโs Mark Dovich to talk about how Armeniaโs tech scene has evolved over the past two decades โ and why the countryโs ambition of becoming a regional tech hub requires a revamped educational system. They also touch on the Armenian Society of Fellows, a new initiative connecting industry leaders in Armenia with their counterparts in the diaspora, as well as Armeniaโs burgeoning wine industry.

ีีฅีฝีกีถีตีธึีฉีจ ีบีกีฟึีกีฝีฟีฅีฌีซีฝ ึ ีฃีฟีพีฅีฌ ีฅีถึ ีตีธึีฉีธึีขีตีกีถ ีฐีฅีฟึีตีกีฌ ีกีฌีซึีถีฅึีซึ Parastoo Bahrami rad, ิฑีฆีกีฟีธึีฉีตีธึีถ, CIVILNET, ฤฐCTฤฐMAฤฐ TV, AZTV, AZERTAC English, Haber Lรผtfen Credits: Ruptly

entry.title: Shoghakat Vardanyan on making โ1489โ

media:group.media:title: Shoghakat Vardanyan on making โ1489โ
media:group.media:description:
Shoghakat Vardanyan, the director of โ1489,โ joins Angela Hassassian in this CivilNet podcast to discuss the making of the film. The award-winning documentary, recently screened at the 21st Annual Golden Apricot International Film Festival in Yerevan, captures her familyโs heart-wrenching experience following the disappearance of her brother, Soghomon Vardanyan, during the 2020 Artsakh war. Shoghakat shares intimate details about the filmmaking process, her family's support, and the film's emotional impact on audiences both in Armenia and abroad.

ีีฝีฏีฅ ีฎีซึีกีถ 21-ึีค ึีกีผีกีฟีธีถีซ ีกีตีฝ ีฟีกึีพีก ีฃีธึีฃีจ ีกีพีกีถีคีกีฏีกีถีซึ ีฟีกึีขีฅึ ีงึโค ีฏีกึีดีซึีจ ึีธีญีกึีซีถีพีฅีฌ ีงึ ีกึีพีฅีฝีฟีกีฃีฅีฟ ิดีกีพีซีฉ ีีธีนีธึีถึีซ ีคีซีฆีกีตีถีซ ีฐีซีดีกีถ ีพึีก ีฟีฅีฒีกึีซ ีฃีธึีฃีกีฃีธึีฎ ีพีกึีบีฅีฟีถีฅึีซ ีฑีฅีผึีฅึีธีพ ีบีกีฟึีกีฝีฟีกีฎี 21 ีดีฅีฟึ ีฅึีฏีกึีธึีฉีตีกีดีข 7 ีฏีกึีบีฅีฟีถีฅึีธีพึ ิฟีกึีบีฅีฟีถีฅึีจ ีฃีธึีฎีฅีฌ ีฅีถ ีฏีซีถ ีฃีธึีฃีกีฃีธึีฎีถีฅึีจ, ีฐีกีดีกีคึีฅีฌ ีง ยซิฑีิฑ ีฏีธีฌีฅีฏีฟีซีพีซยป ีฐีซีดีถีกีคีซึ ีีกีตีซึีซ ิฝีกีนีกีฟีธึึีฅีกีถีจ, ีฐีกีพีกึีกีฎีธึีถ ีงีฌ ีกีถีพีกีถีฅีฌ ีฅีถ ยซีีฅีฒีธึีธีทีธึีดยปึ
